medical_history.chief_complaint: Bilateral, buzzing tinnitus and progressive bilateral hearing loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at the age of 17 and have been progressively worsening since then. The patient has undergone multiple mastoid surgeries due to this issue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was diagnosed with hypercholesterolemia at 17 years of age, with irregular treatment. He underwent three previous surgeries for recurrent problems related to this condition.
medical_history.family_history: There is a strong family history of hypercholesterolemia: three sisters have the condition, and the patient's mother died of a myocardial infarction at the age of 56.
